first_half: A soft answer turneth away wrath:
second_half: but grievous words stir up anger.

first_half: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge:
second_half: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

first_half: Commit thy works unto the Lord,
second_half: and thy thoughts shall be established.

first_half: Pride goeth before destruction,
second_half: and an haughty spirit before a fall.

first_half: Iron sharpeneth iron;
second_half: so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

first_half: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine:
second_half: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

first_half: The name of the Lord is a strong tower:
second_half: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

first_half: Train up a child in the way he should go:
second_half: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

first_half: A man's heart deviseth his way:
second_half: but the Lord directeth his steps.

first_half: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty;
second_half: and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

first_half: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom:
second_half: and with all thy getting get understanding.

first_half: The proverbs of Solomon: A wise son maketh a glad father:
second_half: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

first_half: In all labor there is profit:
second_half: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.

first_half: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge;
second_half: and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

first_half: As in water face answereth to face,
second_half: so the heart of man to man.

first_half: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing,
second_half: and obtaineth favor of the Lord.

first_half: A friend loveth at all times,
second_half: and a brother is born for adversity.

first_half: The path of the just is as the shining light,
second_half: that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

first_half: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise:
second_half: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.

first_half: By humility and the fear of the Lord
second_half: are riches, and honor, and life.
